Description: Online review site Yelp, Inc., and mobile app developer TinyCo, Inc., agreed to settle separate Federal Trade Commission charges that they improperly collected children's information in violation of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act, or COPPA, Rule. Under the terms of the settlements, Yelp will pay a $450,000 civil penalty, while TinyCo will pay a $300,000 civil penalty.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of San Francisco
Private Litigation Case Title: Christopher Javier et al Vs. Eat24, Llc et al

Agency: New York City Commission on Human Rights
